snippet: Coca-Cola’s earnings fell 4 percent last quarter, while revenue fell 3 percent. The company attributed the results to bad weather and global economic weakness.
abstract: Coca-Cola reports second-quarter profit of $2.68 billion, or 59 cents a share, down 4 percent compared with $2.79 billion, or 61 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 3 percent to $12.75 billion from $13.09 billion.
lead_paragraph: Coca-Cola’s earnings fell 4 percent last quarter, while revenue fell 3 percent. The company attributed the results to bad weather and global economic weakness.

headline.main: Profit and Sales Slip for Coke, But It Expects a Better 2nd Half
headline.print_headline: Profit and Sales Slip for Coke, But It Expects a Better 2nd Half
